title: Cyber2A training curriculum for Arctic-AI research ~ DRAFT ~
text:
Preface
Based on the team’s intensive research and training efforts in AI for Arctic Science, we will develop our training curriculum to address three questions:

What are the “must-know” topics in AI to help trainees that have little computer science and computing knowledge to quickly grasp the essence of AI and “AI thinking”?
What is the best way to offer training so AI beginners can get hands-on AI experience and prepare for using and developing AI models to solve real-world research problems? and
How does one best address Arctic science-specific issues (e.g., identification of spatiotemporal autocorrelation and location-awareness) for the effective AI modeling of geophysical phenomena?

The sections presented here potentially fit into a one-week workshop as follows:
crumbs: Preface

title: 1  Breaking the Ice with AI in Arctic Science
text:
Goal
This session kicks off with a relaxed and engaging exploration of AI’s role in Arctic science and geoscience, aiming to lay a solid foundation without overwhelming our audience. We’ll navigate through the use of AI technologies in these fields, highlighting their exciting possibilities and tackling the challenges and ethical considerations. Expect a straightforward, easy-to-follow presentation designed to demystify AI and spark curiosity.
crumbs: 1  Breaking the Ice with AI in Arctic Science

title: 1  Breaking the Ice with AI in Arctic Science
text:
Key Elements
Engaging visuals, simplified explanations, real-world examples, light tone
crumbs: 1  Breaking the Ice with AI in Arctic Science

title: 2  AI for Everyone: An Introductory Overview
text:
Goal
This session aims to introducing AI to a non-specialist audience, ensuring that participants from any background can understand these essential concepts. The focus will be on explaining key terminology and the basic principles of machine learning and deep learning. By the end of this session, participants will have a solid foundational knowledge of key AI concepts, enabling them to better appreciate and engage with more advanced topics in the following sessions
crumbs: 2  AI for Everyone: An Introductory Overview

title: 2  AI for Everyone: An Introductory Overview
text:
Key Elements
ML, DL, NN, CNN, datasets and annotations, training and inference, accuracy and validation, supervised learning, etc.
crumbs: 2  AI for Everyone: An Introductory Overview

title: 3  AI-Ready Data in Arctic Research: Principles and Practices
text:
Goal
This session provides an understanding of ‘AI-ready data’ in Arctic science and geoscience, highlighting the importance of suitable data for AI applications. Participants will learn about creating and managing metadata and organizing data repositories. We’ll discuss best practices for data preparation and structuring for AI processing. By the end, participants will clearly understand AI-ready data characteristics and the steps to transform raw data for AI applications.
crumbs: 3  AI-Ready Data in Arctic Research: Principles and Practices

title: 3  AI-Ready Data in Arctic Research: Principles and Practices
text:
Key Elements
AI-ready data definition, data suitability importance, metadata management, data repository organization, data preparation practices, raw data transformation
crumbs: 3  AI-Ready Data in Arctic Research: Principles and Practices

title: 4  Data Annotation: The Foundation of Deep Learning Models
text:
Goal
This session explores the critical role of training data in deep learning, focusing on data annotation methods, tools, and strategies for acquiring high-quality data. Participants will learn how well-annotated data supports effective deep learning models, understanding the challenges and best practices in data annotation. By the end, participants will be equipped to prepare their datasets for deep learning.
crumbs: 4  Data Annotation: The Foundation of Deep Learning Models

title: 4  Data Annotation: The Foundation of Deep Learning Models
text:
Key Elements
Training data’s role, annotation methods/tools, annotated data’s importance, annotation challenges, annotation best practices, dataset preparation
crumbs: 4  Data Annotation: The Foundation of Deep Learning Models

title: 5  Hands-On Lab: Data Annotation
text:
Goal
This hands-on lab session is designed to give participants practical experience in data annotation for deep learning. Participants will apply the methods, tools, and best practices discussed in the previous session, working directly with datasets to annotate data effectively.
crumbs: 5  Hands-On Lab: Data Annotation

title: 5  Hands-On Lab: Data Annotation
text:
Key Elements
Use of annotation methods and tools, direct dataset interaction
crumbs: 5  Hands-On Lab: Data Annotation

title: 6  The Building Blocks of Neural Networks and Deep Learning
text:
Goal
This session aims to provide a comprehensive introduction to the fundamental components of neural networks and deep learning. Participants will explore the architecture of neural networks, including layers, neurons, weights, and activation functions, as well as the principles behind training models, such as loss functions and optimizers. The goal is to equip participants with a solid understanding of how neural networks are constructed and how they learn, paving the way for deeper dives into specific neural network models and applications in future sessions.
crumbs: 6  The Building Blocks of Neural Networks and Deep Learning

title: 6  The Building Blocks of Neural Networks and Deep Learning
text:
Key Elements
Neurons and layers, weights and biases, activation functions, model training principles, loss functions, optimizers
crumbs: 6  The Building Blocks of Neural Networks and Deep Learning

title: 7  Introduction to PyTorch: Core Functionalities and Advantage
text:
Goal
This session will guide participants through the basics of PyTorch’s core functionalities. We’ll closely examine PyTorch’s capabilities with a specific focus on applying it to a sample dataset, setting the stage for a subsequent hands-on session. The goal is to arm participants with the essential knowledge and confidence required to begin utilizing PyTorch in their deep learning endeavors, ensuring they’re well-prepared for practical application and further exploration.
crumbs: 7  Introduction to PyTorch: Core Functionalities and Advantage

title: 7  Introduction to PyTorch: Core Functionalities and Advantage
text:
Key Elements
PyTorch’s foundational concepts, data processing, model building, sample dataset application
crumbs: 7  Introduction to PyTorch: Core Functionalities and Advantage

title: 8  Hands-On Lab: PyTorch
text:
Goal
In this hands-on lab session, participants will apply their foundational knowledge of PyTorch to a practical exercise. Participants will navigate through data loading, model creation, training, and evaluation within the PyTorch framework.
crumbs: 8  Hands-On Lab: PyTorch

title: 8  Hands-On Lab: PyTorch

Data processing, model building, loss functions, training and evaluation, hands-on PyTorch implementation
crumbs: 8  Hands-On Lab: PyTorch

title: 9  Exploring Advanced Neural Networks: Instance Segmentation
text:
Goal
This session focus on learning advanced neural networks through the instance segmentation. Participants will gain insights into models such as Mask R-CNN, focusing on how these networks are structured, function, and applied to differentiate and precisely segment individual objects within images. The goal is to deepen understanding of instance segmentation’s technical foundations and practical applications, preparing participants for hands-on implementation and exploration of its real-world utility.
crumbs: 9  Exploring Advanced Neural Networks: Instance Segmentation

title: 9  Exploring Advanced Neural Networks: Instance Segmentation
text:
Key Elements
Instance segmentation techniques, models like Mask R-CNN, network structure and functionality, object differentiation and segmentation
crumbs: 9  Exploring Advanced Neural Networks: Instance Segmentation

title: 10  Introduction to Deep Learning Libraries for Image Analysis
text:
Goal
This session introduces participants to specialized deep learning libraries for image analysis, such as Detectron2 and MMSegmentation. The goal is to dive into these libraries’ unique capabilities in handling sophisticated image analysis tasks like instance segmentation and semantic segmentation. Participants will learn how to navigate these libraries and leverage their advanced features for image analysis projects. By session’s end, participants will be adept at selecting and utilizing these libraries to enhance their research or projects in image analysis.
crumbs: 10  Introduction to Deep Learning Libraries for Image Analysis

title: 10  Introduction to Deep Learning Libraries for Image Analysis
text:
Key Elements
Overview of Detectron2 and MMSegmentation, capabilities and features of each library, practical application examples, navigating library documentation and resources
crumbs: 10  Introduction to Deep Learning Libraries for Image Analysis

title: 11  Hands-On Lab: Detectron2
text:
Goal
This hands-on lab session provides participants with practical experience in using Detectron2. Participants will engage in interactive exercises to apply Detectron2 to real-world image analysis tasks, learning how to set up the environment, load data, configure models, and interpret results.
crumbs: 11  Hands-On Lab: Detectron2

title: 11  Hands-On Lab: Detectron2

title: 14  Foundation Models: The Cornerstones of Modern AI
text:
Goal
This session provides an introductory overview of foundation models, such as GPT and SAM, underscoring their revolutionary role in AI’s evolution. Participants will learn how foundation models can be adapted and applied to address unique challenges in the Arctic. The aim is to equip participants with an understanding of foundation models’ potential in enhancing Arctic research and solving domain-specific problems, paving the way for innovative AI-driven solutions in extreme environments.
crumbs: 14  Foundation Models: The Cornerstones of Modern AI

text:
Key Elements
Introduction to foundation models, application in Arctic science and research, adapting models for Arctic challenges
crumbs: 14  Foundation Models: The Cornerstones of Modern AI

title: 15  Hands-On Lab: Foundation Models
text:
Goal
In this hands-on lab, participants will dive into the practical application of foundation models, such as GPT, for Arctic research. The session is designed to guide participants through customizing and applying these advanced AI tools to analyze and interpret data specific to Arctic science challenges. By the lab’s conclusion, participants will have developed the skills to use foundation models creatively and effectively.

title: 15  Hands-On Lab: Foundation Models
text:
Key Elements
Customizing foundation models for Arctic research, addressing real-world Arctic research scenarios

title: 16  AI Ethics
text:
Goal
Review FAIR and CARE Principles, and their relevance to data ethics. Examine how ethical considerations are shared and considered at the Arctic Data Center. Discuss ethical considerations in machine learning.
Notes: see https://learning.nceas.ucsb.edu/2022-09-arctic/sections/14-data-ethics.html

title: 18  Reproducibility
text:
Goal
This session aims to highlight the importance of reproducibility in AI-driven Arctic research. Participants will learn about the challenges and best practices for ensuring that AI models and their results can be reproduced by other researchers, a cornerstone for building trust and advancing the field. The discussion will cover strategies for documenting experiments, sharing data and code, and using version control systems.

title: 19  The Fun and Frontiers of AI: Innovation, Imagination, Interaction
text:
Goal
This session is designed to inspire and engage participants by showcasing the most innovative and imaginative applications of AI across various fields, with a special emphasis on Arctic research. From creative endeavors like art and music generation to practical applications in climate science and wildlife conservation, participants will discover the diverse ways AI can foster innovation, imagination, and interaction. The session aims to stimulate discussion, encourage creative thinking, and highlight the collaborative potential of AI.
